Swell the clarion, sweep the string,</br>Blow into rage the Muse's fires!</br>All thy answers, Eccho, bring,</br>Let wood and dale, let rock and valley ring,</br>'Tis Madness self inspires.
Hail, awful Madness, hail!</br>Thy realm extends, thy powers prevail,</br>Far as the Voyager spreads his ventrous sail.</br>Nor best nor wisest are exempt from thee;</br>Folly — Folly's only free.
Hark! — To the astonished ear</br>The gale conveys a strange tumultuous sound.</br>They now approach, they now appear,—</br>Phrenzy leads her Chorus near,</br>And Daemons dance around,—

Pride — Ambition idly vain,</br>Revenge, and Malice swell her train,—</br>Devotion warped — Affection crost—</br>Hope in Disappointment lost—</br>And injured Merit with a downcast eye,</br>(Hurt by neglect) slow stalking by.
Loud the shouts of Madness rise,</br>Various voices, various cries,—</br>Mirth unmeaning — causeless moans,</br>Bursts of laughter, — heart-felt groans—</br>All seem to pierce the skies.—

Rough as the wintry wave, that roars</br>On Thule's desart shores,</br>Wild raving to the unfeeling air,</br>The fetter'd Maniac foams along,</br>(Rage the burthen of his jarring song)</br>In rage he grinds his teeth, and rends his streaming hair.

No pleasing memory left — forgotten quite</br>All former scenes of dear delight,</br>Connubial love — parental joy—</br>No sympathies like these his soul employ,</br>—But all is dark within, all furious black Despair.
Not so the love-lorn maid,</br>By too much tenderness betrayed;</br>Her gentle breast no angry passion fires,</br>But slighted vows possess, and fainting, soft desires.

She yet retains her wonted flame,</br>All — but in reason, still the same.—</br>Streaming eyes,</br>Incessant sighs,</br>Dim haggard looks, and clouded o'er with care,</br>Point out to Pity's tears, the poor distracted fair.</br>Dead to the world — her fondest wishes crost,</br>She mourns herself thus early lost.—
Now, sadly gay, of sorrows past she sings,</br>Now, pensive, ruminates unutterable things.</br>She starts — she flies — who dares so rude</br>On her sequestered steps intrude?—

'Tis he — the Momus of the flighty train—</br>Merry mischief fills his brain.</br>Blanket-robed, and antick crown'd,</br>The mimick monarch skips around;</br>Big with conceit of dignity he smiles,</br>And plots his frolicks quaint, and unsuspected wiles.—
Laughter was there — but mark that groan,</br>Drawn from the inmost soul!</br>"Give the knife, Demons, or the poisoned bowl,</br>To finish miseries equal to your own."—
Who's this wretch, with horror wild?—</br>—'Tis Devotion's ruin'd child.—</br>Sunk in the emphasis of grief,</br>Nor can he feel, nor dares he ask relief.—

Thou, fair Religion, wast design'd,</br>Duteous daughter of the skies,</br>To warm and chear the human mind,</br>To make men happy, good, and wise.</br>To point, where sits in love arrayed,</br>Attentive to each suppliant call,</br>The God of universal aid,</br>The God, the Father of us all.
First shewn by thee, thus glow'd the gracious scene,</br>'Till Superstition, fiend of woe,</br>Bad doubts to rise, and Tears to flow,</br>And spread deep shades our view and heaven between.

Drawn by her pencil the Creator stands,</br>(His beams of mercy thrown aside)</br>With thunder arming his uplifted hands,</br>And hurling vengeance wide.</br>Hope, at the frown aghast, yet ling'ring, flies,</br>And dash'd on Terror's rocks, Faith's best dependence lies.

But ah! — too thick they croud, — too close they throng,</br>Objects of pity and affright!—</br>Spare farther the descriptive song—</br>Nature shudders at the sight.—</br>Protect not, curious ears, the mournful tale,</br>But o'er the hapless groupe low drop Compassion's veil.</br>
